official-title.#text:
To direct the Commissioner of Food and Drugs to modify
		  the approval of any drug containing controlled-release oxycodone hydrochloride
		  to limit such approval to use for the relief of severe-only instead of
		  moderate-to-severe pain, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Limiting approval
			 of drugs containing controlled-release oxycodone hydrochloride to use for
			 relief of severe-only pain

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall take such actions as may be necessary—

text.#text:
Not later than 90
			 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

to modify the
			 approval of any drug containing controlled-release oxycodone hydrochloride
			 under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to limit such approval to use for the relief of severe-only instead of
			 moderate-to-severe pain; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 505 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505

text.#text:
to limit any
			 subsequent approval of a drug containing controlled-release oxycodone
			 hydrochloride under such section to use for the relief of severe-only
			 pain.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply to drugs introduced or
			 delivered for introduction into interstate commerce on or after the date that
			 is 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
